name: Wql-DataSources-GET-getDataSources
description: [Wql] GET /dataSources/{ID} — Retrieves a data source and primary business object for the specified {ID} for use in a WQL query.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

name: Wql-DataSources-GET-getDataSourceFilters
description: [Wql] GET /dataSources/{ID}/dataSourceFilters/{subresourceID} — Retrieves the data source filter with the specified {ID} for a specific data source.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: subresourceID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

name: Wql-DataSources-GET-getDataSourceFilters_1
description: [Wql] GET /dataSources/{ID}/dataSourceFilters — Retrieves a data source filter of the data source.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: alias
schema.description: The alias of the data source filter.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: searchString
schema.description: The string to be searched in case insensitive manner within the descriptors of the data source filters.

name: Wql-Data-GET-getData
description: [Wql] GET /data — Returns the data from a WQL query.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: query
schema.description: The WQL query that retrieves the data. Example: SELECT worker from allWorkers.

name: Wql-Data-POST-postData
description: [Wql] POST /data — Returns the data from a WQL query. The read-only POST request accommodates queries greater than 2,048 characters.

schema.name: requestBody
schema.description: JSON request body.

name: Wql-DataSources-GET-getDataSources_1
description: [Wql] GET /dataSources — Retrieves a collection of data sources, including their primary business objects.

schema.name: alias
schema.description: The alias of the data source.

schema.name: dataSourceIndexType
schema.description: The parameter is used to filter "Indexed" and "Non-indexed" data sources.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: searchString
schema.description: The string to be searched in case insensitive manner within the descriptors of the data sources.

name: Wql-DataSources-GET-getFields
description: [Wql] GET /dataSources/{ID}/fields/{subresourceID} — Retrieves the field with a specified {ID} for the specific data source. Also retrieves the related business object of the field. You can only view fields and data sources that you have security access to.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: subresourceID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

name: Wql-DataSources-GET-getFields_1
description: [Wql] GET /dataSources/{ID}/fields — Retrieves a field of the data source instance, including the related business object of the field.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: alias
schema.description: The alias of the data source field.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: searchString
schema.description: The string to be searched in case insensitive manner within the descriptors of the data source fields.
